_header: When ended was the life of Saint Cecilia
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Canon’s Yeoman’s Prologue of the Canterbury Tales — 166 lines in rhyming couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
WHan ended was the liff of seint Cecileer we hadde riden fully fyve
                    myle…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…syn that my lord is goon I wol not sparesuche thing as I
                    knowe I wol declare
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next / folwith the prolog of the Chanons yoman &
                        cetera (f. 222v); the Chanons yoman (RT); Here endith the
                    Chanons yoman his prolog… (f. 225)

BodBar20.First Lines:
Whan endid was þe tale of Seyn CecileEr we fully hadden riden
                    fye myle…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…Sethyns þat my lord is gone I wil not spareSuche
                    þing as I know I wil declare
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…& here bygynnyth þe prologe of þe yoman (f. 169);
                    yoman (RT); Here endith the prologe… (f. 172)

Bod414.First Lines:
[W]han endid was the life of seint CecileOr we hadde riden fully
                    fyue myle…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…Syn my lord is gone I wille declareSuch thing as I knowe I
                    wille declare
Bod414.Attributed Title: The prolog of the Chanons yoman (f. 118v)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
Whan ended was þe life of seint CecileEr we fulli hadde reden
                    fyve myle…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…Syns that my lorde is gon I wol not spareSiche þing as I
                    know I shal declare
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
…And next beginneth the / Prolog of the Chanons yoman (f. 142); The
                    Nonne (RT [sic]); Here endeth the Prolog of the Chanons yoman… (f.
                    144)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
Whan ended was þe lif of seint CecileEr we fully had riden
                    five myle…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…It wol vs make beggers atte lasteWhiles þis yoman was
                    þus in þis talkyng…
BodLauMis600.Note:
VIII.685-719 lost (resupplied in the seventeenth century on f.
                    194).
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
…Here begynneþ þe prolog of the chanons yoman (f. 192);
                    þe chanons yoman (RT)

BodLauMis739.First Lines:
[W]Han endid was the lyfe of Seint CecilieOr we fully had riden
                    fyfe myle…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…Syns þat my lorde is goone I will not spareSuche thyng
                    as I knowe I will declare

BodRawPoe149.First Lines:
When endid was the lif of seynt CecileOr we fully had riden fyve
                    myle…
BodRawPoe149.Last Lines:
…Sith that my lorde is gone I wil not spareSoche thyng as I
                    know I wil declare
BodRawPoe149.Attributed Title: prolog chanon yoman (f. 86, margin); the chanons yoman (RT)

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
Whan that told was þe lyfe of seint CecileEr we fully hadde
                    riden fyue Mile…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:
…He coude al clene turnen vp & dounAnd paue it al of
                    siluer and of golde…
OxfChrCh152.Attributed Title: Here begynneth the Chanons yemans prologe (f. 238)

OxfCCC198.First Lines:
Whan ended was þe lyf of seint CecileEr we fully hadde ryden
                    fyue myle…
OxfCCC198.Last Lines:
…Syþens þat my lord is gon I wol not spareSuch
                    þing as I knowe I wol declare

OxfNew314.First Lines:
WHenne told was þe lif of Saint CecilyEr we hadde riden fulli
                    v myle…
OxfNew314.Last Lines:
…Syn that my lord is goon I wol not spareSuch þing as I
                    knowe I wol declare
OxfNew314.Attributed Title:
…And / Here begynneth the prolog of þe chanons yeman (f. 170);
                    Chanons yeman (RT); Here endith þe Prolog… (f. 172)

OxfTri49.First Lines:
Whenne tolde was the lif of seint CecileEre we had ridyn fully v
                    myle…
OxfTri49.Last Lines:
…Sithins that my lorde is gon I wil nought spareSuche thingis
                    as I knowe I wille declare

CULDd424.First Lines:
WHan that told was the lyf of Seynt CecileEr we had riden fully
                    fyue myle…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…Syn þat my lord is gon I wyl nat spareSwich thyng as
                    that I knowe I wil declare
CULDd424.Note:
VIII.711 omitted (‘deficit versus’ in margin); 564-5
                    precede 562-3.
CULDd424.Attributed Title:
…& bigynneth the / Prologe of the Chanouns Ȝeman (f. 202);
                    Heere endeth the prologe of the Chanouns ȝeman… (f. 204)

CULGg427.First Lines:
…[torn]hat told was the lif of seynt Cecile[torn]e fully
                    haddyn redyn fyue myle…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…Al that I can a non now wele I telleSyn he is goon the foule
                    fend hym quelle…
CULGg427.Attributed Title:
Here folwyn the mery wordys of chaucer and of þe host / And the
                    Prologe of the chanounys man (f. 380v)

CULIi326.First Lines:
When endid was the lif of Seint CecileEr we fully hadde riden five
                    myle…
CULIi326.Last Lines:
…Sith that my lorde is gone I wil not spareSuche thing as I
                    knowe I will declare

                    158v)

CamFitzMc181.First Lines:
[W]Hen ended was the Tale of seynt CecyleEr we had Ryden fully v
                    myle…
CamFitzMc181.Last Lines:
…Syth my mayster ys gon y woll not spareSuch thyng as y know y
                    woll declare
CamFitzMc181.Attributed Title:

                    knowe I wil declare

WHan tolde was the lyff of seynt CicileEr we fully haddyn ryden
                    fyve myle…
BLAdd5140.Last Lines:
…Syn that my lord is gon I wol nat spareSuch thyng as I knowe

BLAdd35286.First Lines:
At boughton vnder the blee vs gan atakeA man that clothed was in
                    clothes blake…
BLAdd35286.Last Lines:
…Syn that my lord is goon I wol nat spareSwich thing as I know
                    I wol declare

BLEge2726.First Lines:
Whan that told was the lyf of seint CecilieOr we hade yryden fully
                    fyve myle…
BLEge2726.Last Lines:
…Sen þat my lord is goon I woll you
                    declareSoch thyng as I knowe I woll you declare
BLEge2726.Note:
VIII.584-6 omitted; 564-5 precede 562-3; spurious lines follow
                    593.
BLEge2726.Attributed Title:
…& incipit prologus seruientis Canonici de multiplicacione
                    (f. 224); Hic desinit prologus per Canonici seriuentem narratus…
                    (f. 226v)

WHan ended was the lyf of seint CecileOr we fully hadde riden fyue

BLEge2863.Last Lines:
